title: TOXIC PLAYERS: People who say "kill yourself"
body:
This type of behaviour is above and beyond normal trash talk. They take personal insults to a whole new level that can affect people quite deeply. There are a lot of young people committing suicide and depression affects millions. I report these people in game and screen shot their chat to send in a ticket. Even though I have done this I see many summoners who show this type of behaviour still allowed in the Rift. 

So what type of action should be taken against these people. Is everyone fine with how everything is at the moment or should we as a community speak out and say this isn't the type of player base we want to be affiliated with.

Perhaps this should go beyond the normal levels of the warning system. More people like this getting banned means less toxic, tilted, feeding and afking players in your promo games.

Leave your thoughts below!

replies.body:
100% percent agree with what you're saying here. This kind of behavior is not something anyone wants to see in their games.

As of right now _"kill yourself"_ and affiliated terms are ranked as a serious offense and will almost always lead to punishment through the current [player reform system](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/player-behavior/new-player-reform-system-heads-testing). However despite this, you may still encounter death threats like this in some of your games.

> The goal is that the new tribunal will help the Player Behavior team focus and learn about stuff like this. This is where possibly we could have steeper punishments or better detection for this behavior.

> The tribunal is scheduled for a release later this season, so hopefully we aren't too far off from an announcement regarding this.

Thanks for talking about this BTW, it's important we bring these things up and raise some awareness.

I'm gonna be frank here. Unless you have actual depression, like the diagnosable kind not the #WhitePeopleProblems kind, I have never understood people's fascination with verbal bullying.

Like, maybe my views on this are skewed because I spent a lot of my childhood at my dad's engineering workplace where cursing is basically an adjective, but I've always understood that words are absolutely meaningless until you add context and, more importantly, your own feelings to it. Hell, I was a WEIRD kid, like insulted by random strangers across the street levels of weird. I spent my childhood being called everything you can think of, not just by others but by my family, and I've never once said to myself "Oh wow, that person called me a stupid head, better get the bleach."

Especially with "Cyberbullying", they're words on a screen by some random 11 year old that doesn't know when to shut their mouth, I just don't understand how people can take that seriously. You have mute buttons, you have block and ignore buttons, you have all these tools that literally erase the problem from your reality. The only way I can understand this becoming a problem is if they're spamming all your social networks, making new accounts to get past your blocks, and keeping up a barrage of nonsense. And that's called harassment people, we don't need another word for it just report it to the police and boom, it's dealt with.

Bullying used to be about actual physical abuse. Like some guy or girl will show up with a couple of their mates and kick your head in until you give them what they want. I'm sorry, but this is just a non issue to me.

And if you DO have depression, and this kind of thing affects you that much, I'm sorry but you shouldn't even be on the Internet because there is SO much worse waiting for you out there than ANYTHING I've seen in the League community. You need therapy to help you come to terms with it, medication to help you deal with it, not a bunch of people holding your hand and telling you it'll stop if we ban enough people because news flash it will never go away, EVER. You could ban thousands of people a day from the Internet and tens of thousands more will replace them, because it's the Internet and it's anonymous and 11 year old idiots have nothing better to do with their day.

I don't entirely disagree, I just hope that maybe I can give you a bit of insight. I want to respond to this paragraph specifically:

> And if you DO have depression, and this kind of thing affects you that much, I'm sorry but you shouldn't even be on the Internet because there is SO much worse waiting for you out there ...

As someone who DOES suffer from chronic depression, and as an introvert, if only it were that easy. I do avoid the internet people in general. I stick to things like youtube videos and _playing League with friends_. It's worth noting that I never play solo anymore, I just don't enjoy it, but when I'm feeling like utter shit, League is my _escape_. 

League is my constant, my routine, the thing that I can trust to be consistent and always there. And in fact in normals I rarely encounter negativity. Now when it's really bad I don't do anything at all, but if I just need a little pick me up then League with friends is my go to.

Sometimes, that one asshat who decides to say something like "How much did your friend pay to get boosted to Diamond" when I know damn well he got there through his own damn hard work and effort can be enough to really upset you.

In my experience it's honestly rarely the "kys" or the "n00b jungler" that really get to you, because they are fairly meaningless and impotent. It's more often the consistency, the ones who all game are telling you how shit you are and "omg this f'king jungler never ganked" even though you ganked them plenty, or "f'king support taking my CS" when it was one and it was an accident. It's the comments that are designed to frustrate, the comments that have no factual basis and are constant _and the in game behaviour that goes with it_ that really gets to you.

I know to take a step back, to remember it's just a game and that it doesn't matter, but not everyone is so lucky to have the presence of mind to do that.

Do I agree that some people need to harden up? Sure. Do I think that we should be callous to those who are affected by negativity and call them little bitches for getting upset? Definitely not. Just because someone CAN take abuse, doesn't mean they SHOULD, and it doesn't by any means make it right.
This is correct. Very correct.

While this behaviour is scum, and i do not support it in any way!  

People do need to just harden the fuck up! 

The world is full of terrible things, look at the immigrant situation, an entire country has had to drop everything and run just to survive, to live in camps in countries that don't even want them. Huge groups of people in India, Africa, China etc live in slums or worse, people have seen their children executed by isis before their eyes and on live streams, people have had their homes destroyed by cyclones in the islands and their whole family now lives under a tarpaulin and a few sheets of corrugated iron. 

So when someone on a computer game (to even have the time and money to engage in such a trivial activity shows how much better off you are than the majority of people in the world) is slightly offensive to you, its literally NOTHING in comparison. So the people who take this trash talking so seriously need to get their act into gear and place themselves in the bigger picture. Don't be one of those people who gets 'deeply' offended because they were accidentally called 'bisexual' instead of 'pansexual' and go on a rant as if their life was in danger. Seriously, people get blown up on a daily basis overseas, the world has far bigger problems than whatever attention-seeking sexuality you want to be, or what so-and-so called you on a fictional computer game when you won and he didn't, or that you tripped on a stair and now want to sue the person who owned the staircase. Because if you're offended so deeply by these things I'm sure you'll have no problem finding hundreds of millions of people across the world that would gladly give everything they own to switch situations with you, and i wish you the best of luck in this hard world.

Seriously, harden the fuck up. Yes depression affects a lot of people nowadays, but thats no excuse to be so soft and whinge about such trivial thing , (and I'm allowed to say these things because i have actually suffered bad depression in the past myself so i know what its like.) 

Yes its an awful thing to say to someone in any context, but in reality, no one is going to kill themselves because someone online was being a dick. But in all seriousness, if someone did kill themselves over something so trivial, then at that point, I'm pretty sure it was going to happen anyway regardless of what the last straw happened to be.

Obviously my post here isn't particularly PC, but its the hard truth. Yes being intentionally cruel to someone should never happen under any circumstance, but we are bigger people than to be 'deeply hurt' by words that some dumbass in his mums basement said when he lost a game.

Whilst I do agree that sometimes people take others comments to personally and have often thought people just need to not be so sensitive. I think going to such a personal level as to tell another human to kill themselves is an unacceptable social behaviour that it needs to be taught to everyone that you can't just say that. I don't know where people get off thinking it's okay to say that to someone else without actually understanding what it could mean. 

Internet bullying is a real thing and real people have taken their own lives over it. We have no idea what's going on in peoples lives and sometimes the internet is their only escape. It's not just a matter of 'hardening up' or 'drinking some concrete' but being able to be in a society where people have a level of decency to not threaten someone's life. 

I know we can't control what people say of course but Riot can definitely control whether people can play their game or not.

A society where people have a level of decency to not threaten someones life, has never existed in all of human history, and likely will never exist in the future. 

The only difference being that in the past people didn't kill themselves because someone else was a bit mean, and the reason for that is because they had more important things to deal with, like collecting enough food so they wouldn't starve, protecting against Viking raids, battling plague. Hell 50% of children didn't even make it to 10 years old, so they didn't have the time to get all moody and 'fuck-the-world' because their neighbour said something bad, they couldn't afford to worry about something so trivial (and it was even a time where death threats had much more chance of being carried out as well).

But because we don't have Vikings or the black plague or have to go out and hunt for food, our society has become weak, we take things like PCness and health and safety wayyyyy too far. We put up safety handrails for everyone and for everything, even on the internet.

And if you put up handrails for everything, the day the handrail comes down, everybody falls over the edge and dies because they don't know how to think for themselves.

We're not talking about people who just need to harden up. We're talking about people who have depression or have something else going on in their life that they want to use games as an escape. 

Sure people are over sensitive but are you going to say that to someone has depression?

Games are still an escape, you get to walk around as a giant golden bird headed demi-god sending your soldiers to obliterate your enemies, or as a giant space dragon ready throw celestial bodies at bad guys, thats a pretty big escape from reality in my opinion, but it is a team game and that means you do share it with other real people, and whenever groups of people come together there is always a conflict of opinions (especially when there is a concept of winning and losing), you cant stop that, you just have to deal with it. Ideally they shouldn't say anything bad, but the world isn't ideal (even runeterra the fictional world we escape to, isn't ideal) and at some point people just need to accept that. 

If you are so at risk of killing yourself over what someone says on an online game i'd be seriously questioning why you'd put yourself in a situation that is known for toxicity such as lol in the first place, there are hundreds of single player games just as if not more fun than lol that don't involve other people, sure its not fair that you cant play lol because of that, but seriously if you're at risk of killing yourself, you don't put yourself in situations that make it worse. Thats like going base jumping if you have a heart condition, its not not a good idea no matter how much you want to do it or how unfair it is that you cant.

Yes people who say things with a direct intention to be cruel should receive some disciplinary action, but the truth is, you cant catch them all no matter what you do (short of removing chat altogether) 

Its like murders and drug dealers, yes they are bad people, and we need to do everything we can to punish/prevent them, but in reality, we cant get them all. So if you have a drug problem (in this case Depression), you don't rely on the police (Riot) to stop you taking drugs by catching the dealers, you remove yourself from the situation (play a different game), you don't walk home though the back alleys where the dealers hang out (toxic people on lol). You go to via a main street or park or the beach (Skyrim, Assassins creed, etc etc). thats just common sense. Don't put yourself in situations that could worsen your situation. Yes its not fair that if you're suicidal you cant play lol, but if you're at that stage i think that going without lol for a little while is the least of your problems.

(FYI im not saying people with depression shouldn't play lol, I'm saying they need to judge what is best for them and their situation. Im sure psychiatrists would advise suicidal people not to play lol if they knew the stresses and stuff in the game.) 

and as for saying that to someone that has depression, yes i'll say it, they aren't crazy people or babies, they still have some rational thought. 

Depression sucks (i know) but you can either give into it and spiral down until you stop functioning altogether, or you can take action against it. People who have depression should never just be thrown out into the cold to fend for themselves, nor should you say "get over it and harden up" because it doesn't work like that. However, some things are appropriate to say 'harden up' to, and killing yourself over a comment some pre-pubesent brat that you'll never see again made online, is one of those things.
This. This is truth.

Your comment shows a laughable lack of understanding of the debilitating illness that is depression. 
If you break a leg, just man up and walk it off?

I had bad depression for 3 years, so yea.. i think i have a fair understanding of it. Why is that laughable? it certainly wasn't for me. Depression isn't a laughing matter mate.

Im not saying you should get up and walk off, I'm saying you should crawl off, you broke a leg after all, not your back, and you should be thankful of it, some people who break bones aren't so lucky.

If you do not discipline, or there is no repercussion to the behavior than positive re enforcement to a degree takes place where the behavior becomes a norm since the proper authorities are not taking action and spreads like a virus. Therefore if we discipline than the behavior has a negative re enforcement due to repercussions therefore will greatly reduce the type of behavior (not eradicate but greatly reduce)

Would you rather go into a game a some one displaying this behavior after a minor mistake or would you rather a peaceful game? I would like the peaceful one with no distractions

We already are disciplining this behaviour?

there is a whole chat ban/tribunal/permaban system made to deal with this stuff, but you cant catch everyone without catching some innocents too, and is it better to let a few guilty people not lose their accounts or let a few innocent ones suffer and lose all their skins and account because of it?

The thing I am unclear on is how you would catch an innocent player?. I mean if you didnt commit the crime you shouldnt do the time. so if you werent negative and even if the system banned you, a simple ticket to riot support would easily unban the account. Not to mention there has to be at least 10 cases of reports (thats over 10 games not like everyone in a single game reporting you) before the system actually takes action.

Im saying that the only way that you are going to get ALL the bad guys is to make a bot that punishes people every time it sees the phrase "kill yourself" in a chat message, which means if you say "dude don't jump on Jax and Lee because you'll kill yourself doing that." then you're innocent and you still get banned. But if you make the system more lenient to stop that happening, then some toxic people will inevitably fall though the cracks and that defeats the whole purpose, because we already have a punishment system that deals with toxicity, so there'd be no point making another one that STILL doesn't get everyone. Whats the point?

Basically what I'm saying is this: You cant make the punishment system any harsher than it is without punishing innocent people, and seeming Riot is trying to make money they cant afford to punish people who don't deserve it because its bad for business. 

also if you're permabanned Riot will NOT re-activate your account no matter what, they have said that multiple times, so if you're innocent and you get permabanned, thats it, game over. Bad luck.

(Not to mention this argument is completely pointless because one of our human rights is freedom of speech, so even if its bad language people are still within their right to say it. So Riot is actually breaking our human rights already by introducing chat bans.)

I think you are misunderstanding how the tribunal works, or I am not correctly conveying how the tribunal works. You do not get banned off a single incident. It takes  a total and minimum of 10 cases for a person to receive a ban or punishment. that is the same with leaver buster where a ban due to leaver buster has to be 10 cases you left a game. Same with vulgarity and now that I read your comment I am seeing you are looking at putting in phrases to be detected by bots. Which would also have to be in a total of 10 games for the bot to ban you or put restriction on chat. Riot does not ban you off a single offence, but say over a couple of years you have had reports of vulgarity and this year you got your 10th report. The system will dig up all your previous offenses and present a tribunal case that will result in a ban or restriction. But people do it too often and they end up being banned every two to three months
No way if you say it once , twice or nine times and got no reports will you get banned, as it is not a tribunal case until the lucky number 10. So no innocent player will ever get banned.

You just described the current system to me and said that it works... so why do you want to change it?

it works fine as it is, like i said. 

it seems its you thats misunderstanding not me, I'm happy with the current system, but this entire post is about making it harsher, and my point is the harsher you make it the more likely you are to have innocent casualties.

so therefore we shouldn't make it harsher, people should just toughen the fuck up and not rely on Riot to solve all their problems.

You my friend have clearly misread the post above it says nothing on improving the system, its about getting rid of the warning phase and heading straight into the baning account step (taking proper action).
It is however on making the punishments harsher ,the system is sound and I was explaining this cause it didnt look like you understood how it worked and why it was sound. I was only addressing your comment on innocents getting caught up in it which will be highly unlikely.

 Like in my opinion the only way I see it getting harsher is to move it to a three strike system. Which is one strike after 10 cases temporary ban for two weeks , second strike one month ban , third strike Perma ban. I have played this game for 4 years I have yet to receive a chat restriction or a ban off chat verbal abuse. You are there to play a game not off load verbal abuse due to anonymity.

 But even so there is no way if you have never done anything wrong for you to get flagged for verbal abuse. I barely even use chat unless I require to time summoners or say something of utmost importance. 

Also for your freedom of speech thing , you remember that accept button that comes up after every patch. That gives riot the power to do what ever they want which includes moderating your behavior in their game and since its a User Agreement between two parties and you have read all the fine print on summoners code .You will understand they do not condone this behavior at all and I believe they state to take action based on your behavior.

This entire thread is about improving the system, you talk about chaining the system in a way that you think is best (harsher punishments) that IS 'improving' the system.

The reason they don't make it harsher is because IF someone who was innocent got caught up, it would be bad for them, and don't try to tell me that its almost impossible! innocent people go to prison all the time, and the judicial system has a WAYYYYYYYYYYY harder look at separating the innocent from the guilty than some online game, so if it can happen there it WILL happen here.

I have read the full terms of use and the summoners code actually, and the summoners code is stated as purely guidelines. The only thing they mention about negative wording, in the actual terms of use says:
"The following are examples of behavior that warrant disciplinary measures: ... Harassing, stalking, or threatening any other users in the Game."

also included in that 'warrant disciplinary measures' is: Identifying yourself to anyone on the game.
not to mention that they specifically state NOT to show any riot member any fan-artwork or ideas you have for the game. (even though they have a sub-board for that on their website) 

they also state that they can terminate you account without warning at any time for any or NO reason.

so the user agreement isn't quite what you thought, seeming showing fan artwork to rioters and identifying yourself to friends on the game are just as punishable as harassing someone with negative wording.

See like there was no mention on "improving the system" that is what you derived from the original post. A system is like a chain of processes. But I derived what end result would be better hence why I stated harsher punishments. 

Now the system flawed in real life since there is like no hard evidence (due to no one being around or no record of things)  in cases that lead to innocent being sent to prison. That how ever is the real world. In a computer data base where every game, every message, every ping is recorded and there is hard evidence you cannot say its flawed. 

Its like sitting in a room with a piece of cake and a security camera, and eating that piece but denying it after. The hard evidence is recorded. And every game is recorded so there is no way an innocent player is punished. 

Also waying out verbal abuse against identifying yourself to anyone. I think the verbal abuse is a more prominent issue and the topic at hand wouldnt you agree?.

"Perhaps this should go beyond the normal levels of the warning system"

"Is everyone fine with how everything is at the moment or should we as a community speak out"

"More people like this getting banned means less toxic, tilted, feeding and faking players"

all these are saying "perhaps we should think about changing (improving) the system to make it better for us"

so yea.. there was mention... thats kinda what the posy was about, that theres too much toxicity and should we make the system harsher to stop it.

No system is perfect including the lol one, if it was then toxic players wouldn't be around still and innocents wouldn't get banned. 

and innocents do get punished! i myself got banned from the boards, when i wrote a comment on poppy's release page asking about the relevance of a hammer to her old kit, then someone commented on my comment with a 'WOW YOU GUYS NEED TO WATCH THIS FACEBOOK VID! EVEN I DIDNT KNOW THAT' post, and the next day both me and that person were banned. I tried to talk to a rioter to say it was a mistake, but how could i? i was banned and couldn't comment or post anything, so in the end i had to use someone else's account (which breaks the terms of agreement, for both me and them) so i could talk to a rioter and explain the situation, and they gave my account back with a nice apology. Luckily it was only banned from the boards but if the system was harsher like you say, it could have been worse. as it turns out, someone just pressed the wrong button and banned the wrong account, it happens, even when considering permabanning someone you can still press the wrong button, (and permabans will under no circumstances be undone) 

Yes i agree, verbal abuse is way worse than identifying yourself, however that is not stated, they are both lumped into the same list in the terms and agreement.

Like I said its open to be derived in any way people want. I derived it differently to you like i said in the post above. Hopefully this helps you understand.

A "warning system" would be different to a "banning system". It would either be an extension or completely different system purely focused on presentation of the info. 

By that I mean the warning system could be improved to display your impending ban or restriction every time you log in so you know that it will happen if you break the rules one more time. As for the other points I have stated examples to them in the replies prior to this one.

Also your example of the post are invalid since the program used or system used to ban you from forums is completely different to the one they use to ban peoples accounts (human error is at play and there is only SINGLE instances that lead to a ban compared to the game where it has to be a TOTAL of 10 cases for a ban to take place). (the forum is contained of thousands or post and that is the only form of evidence they work off because there is no other forms of evidence)
(also there have been cases where permabans have been undone, maybe not on vulgarity but other instances)

That is the reason why the current system I was explaining to you is full proof, it will not ban you if you are innocent (this if for the game and accounts not forums just so you can understand better). If you haven't used any vulgarity you are not in risk.

And for the last point verbal abuse is a much more prominent case than identifying yourself. Therefore they are addressing that first with utmost importance.

Look. It's bad, but it's really soft to get worked up about it.

I like to have fun and I talk a bit in all chat. I'll say a few things in jest without ever being profane. You know, something along the lines of, "Sorry guys, I'm a god at Thresh."

Someone will respond with something like, "Shut up n_gger" or "Shut up G_ok" - it happens a lot.

If it bothers me, then I be like, "Muted. Bye". Then I mute them, play and I forget about it.

Just drink some concrete and harden up a bit.

Yes, except - what if you've had a really bad day? What if your life is in ruins and you're using league as an escape medium? 

Not everyone has such a positive outlook on life. Hell, some are already recovering from suicidal thoughts, or even still have them. It is NOT their fault. So maybe be considerate of other human beings going through tough times, and less into victim shaming. People shouldn't have to 'drink some concrete', because they shouldn't be abused on a god damn game and told to kill themselves.

Is this you? There's a suicide hotline if you're afflicted by suicidal thoughts. It ain't worth it son. Much like risking getting shutdown to steal razorbeaks. "Not wurf bruvva!"

Nah, I'm not victim shaming. I can see how it may have sounded that way. My bad.

For all descriptive standards, there are normative ones. Ideally, no-one would tell others to off themselves. However, it will happen. Now that we understand it's an inevitability, you must protect yourself from such toxicity. Note their transgression. Bring it to the attention of other players in the game. Mute the bastard. Report him afterwards.

Don't off yourself. You have much to live for. Add me in game if you want to duo.

I would recommend doing some research on depression and why people may have suicidal thoughts before you make stupid comments. When people get so depressed that they're actually thinking of killing themselves they're not always going to call a hotline.

 It only takes great support from the community, family and friends to beat something like that. It's not something that you can just tell yourself to get over or simply start thinking a different way. It's something that affects you on a hormonal and chemical level in the brain. 

I've never suffered from depression myself but I can at least understand that it's not just something to shrug off. Idiotic comments from naive toxic teenagers shouldn't be what pushes people over the edge but sometimes it can be. We're not just talking about making someone tilted any more we're talking life and death.

Totally. If there is the slightest chance it can cause someone who is susceptible to abuse to take their own life then it must stop immediately. Mute button will not suffice.

I'm nitpicking, but you just told me you aren't susceptible as those with depression are. So, in your case, drink some concrete - directing this at you and you alone.

I didn't make this post for me but for the community as a whole. Your "drink some concrete" comment is quite stale. I never said it affects me but I'm saying it does and will affect others. People who may have to much social anxiety to even create a post or even comment.

Read Seshomaru's post. He makes a point that I was too stupid to articulate.

My lay opinion is that we should be more, "Dude, you're stronger than this. Chin up, shoulders back!", rather than, "Oh, you poor, poor darling. Come, let us coddle you."

That's how I was raised. Tough times? Get tough.
Not everyone is raised like you.

are you saying people have to stay how they were raised?

Taking that logic, if you were raised to be a bully, then you should stay as a bully because thats how you were raised.

Despite how people were raised, they always have a choice.

People always have a choice to grow and change how they were raised. But how does someone do that without outside influence. How does a person know what they're doing or how they're acting wrong if they've only known one way in life.

Some people are raised to be afraid if they live in an abusive environment and someone stupid comment on the internet could be what puts them over the edge. 

Why is this even an argument. Bottom line is people shouldn't reach this level of toxicity and be apart of this community. It's not acceptable social behaviour and I can't understand why people think it's okay for others to tell them to kill themselves. It doesn't matter how it affects someone it matters that they said it and they probably don't know if that person has depression or not. 

You think it is okay for people to tell others to kill themselves?

With so much TV and online access its impossible to not get outside influences in your life. So unless you're a complete imbecile, you'll sooner or later realise that living in an abusive environment is not a normal way of life, after that its just willpower, if people truly have the will to change, then they will. 

The bottom line is that people shouldn't reach this level of toxicity in this community, But its also that we shouldn't make war with other people, and Europe (and most of the rest of the world) has torn itself apart twice in recent history doing just that. 

Theres a difference between what should be done and what can be done, and you just cant vett out every single person that has a contrary opinion to you. Sure you can make a bot that bans anyone instantly as soon as it hears the words 'kill yourself' but then you just banned someone for saying "dude don't jump into Jax and Lee you'll kill yourself" as well. 

Sure the threat of harshly punishing everyone who mentions anything about killing yourself, will indeed stop some people from saying it, but being banned from lol is nothing compared with the death sentence or life inprisonment which is the punishment for murder, yet people still murder other people. 

So if the concept of death or rotting in a prison doesn't deter some people from doing what they want, how do you think a chat ban will?

No i don't think its alright to say that, (even though we have the right of 'freedom of speech' so technically they should be allowed to say whatever they want without any repercussions) but i also think that someone saying that is such a minor issue compared with other problems in the world that require our more immediate attention. 

Its like stubbing your toe, yes it hurts but when your friend has a broken spine and moving is agony, you suddenly put it in perspective, and you think to yourself "should i really yell and scream and make a fuss that i stubbed my toe, when my friend right next to me will be paralysed for the rest of his life? hmmm maybe i shouldn't."

Thats why young children cry when they get hurt, its because they haven't yet been able to put hat small pain in perspective, so to them its the worst thing in the world. But as they grow up they learn to realise that falling over in the playground is not the end of the world and there are far worse things that can happen, and so they stop crying when it happens.

Physical pain is **COMPLETELY** different to depression. 

No matter how small an insult is, you sit and think on it. You make something so insignificant into a huge deal, and you have little to no power to stop it; it's generally very subconscious. Suddenly, killing yourself doesn't seem like such a bad idea after all. How could it be bad if it ends your pain, right? You are blinded by it, and there is no light anymore. 

And yes, there are other problems in the world. They're not Riot's problem, that's not something Riot are paid to deal with. Controlling their community, on the other hand, is definitely something they **can** and **should** deal with.
